general_city_data.description: São Paulo, a vibrant metropolis in southeastern Brazil, is a global hub renowned for its diverse culture, robust economy, and impressive skyline. It's a city of contrasts, where towering skyscrapers stand alongside historical landmarks and bustling avenues give way to tranquil parks. São Paulo boasts a world-class culinary scene, offering everything from traditional Brazilian fare to international cuisine. Its thriving arts and entertainment scene includes numerous museums, theaters, and music venues. The city is a melting pot of cultures, reflected in its diverse neighborhoods and vibrant street life. Known for its fast-paced energy and entrepreneurial spirit, São Paulo is a city that never sleeps.
general_city_data.weather: Subtropical climate with distinct seasons. Summers (Dec-Feb) are hot and humid, while winters (Jun-Aug) are mild and dry.
general_city_data.attractions: Ibirapuera Park, Paulista Avenue, São Paulo Museum of Art (MASP), Municipal Market, Liberdade (Japanese neighborhood), Pinacoteca do Estado de São Paulo, Theatro Municipal
general_city_data.history: Founded in 1554 by Jesuit missionaries, São Paulo initially served as a small settlement. Its growth remained slow until the late 19th century when it became a major center for coffee production. The influx of immigrants from Europe, Asia, and other parts of Brazil transformed the city into a diverse and industrial powerhouse. Today, São Paulo is the economic and cultural capital of Brazil and one of the largest cities in the world.

points_of_interest.name: Ibirapuera Park
points_of_interest.description_poi: One of the largest urban parks in South America, offering green spaces, museums, auditoriums, and recreational activities.
points_of_interest.address: Av. Pedro Álvares Cabral - Vila Mariana, São Paulo - SP, 04094-050

points_of_interest.name: MASP (São Paulo Museum of Art)
points_of_interest.description_poi: Famous for its iconic architecture and extensive collection of European art, including works by Renoir, Van Gogh, and Picasso.
points_of_interest.address: Av. Paulista, 1578 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, 01310-200

points_of_interest.name: Avenida Paulista
points_of_interest.description_poi: A major avenue in São Paulo, known for its cultural institutions, shops, restaurants, and vibrant atmosphere. Closed to cars on Sundays.
points_of_interest.address: Av. Paulista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: Mercado Municipal de São Paulo (Mercadão)
points_of_interest.description_poi: A historic public market offering a wide variety of fresh produce, spices, cheeses, meats, and prepared foods. Famous for its mortadella sandwich.
points_of_interest.address: R. Cantareira, 306 - Centro Histórico de São Paulo, São Paulo - SP, 01024-000

points_of_interest.name: Theatro Municipal de São Paulo
points_of_interest.description_poi: A historic theater known for its stunning architecture and performances of opera, ballet, and classical music.
points_of_interest.address: Praça Ramos de Azevedo, s/n - República, São Paulo - SP, 01037-010

opening_hours.general: Varies depending on performance schedule. Check website.

points_of_interest.name: Pinacoteca do Estado de São Paulo
points_of_interest.description_poi: One of the most important art museums in Brazil, focusing on Brazilian art from the 19th century to the present day.
points_of_interest.address: Praça da Luz, 2 - Luz, São Paulo - SP, 01020-020

points_of_interest.name: Liberdade District
points_of_interest.description_poi: São Paulo's Japanese neighborhood, offering a vibrant atmosphere, Japanese restaurants, shops, and cultural events.

points_of_interest.name: Catedral da Sé de São Paulo
points_of_interest.description_poi: The largest cathedral in São Paulo, known for its neo-Gothic architecture and stained-glass windows.
points_of_interest.address: Praça da Sé, s/n - Centro Histórico de São Paulo, São Paulo - SP, 01001-000

points_of_interest.name: Vila Madalena
points_of_interest.description_poi: A bohemian neighborhood known for its street art, bars, restaurants, and nightlife.
points_of_interest.address: Vila Madalena, São Paulo - SP, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: Beco do Batman
points_of_interest.description_poi: A famous alleyway in Vila Madalena known for its vibrant and ever-changing street art.
points_of_interest.address: R. Gonçalo Afonso - Vila Madalena, São Paulo - SP, 05436-050

itinerary_response.overall_description: This itinerary focuses on experiencing the cultural heart of São Paulo, exploring its art, history, and vibrant street life. It's designed for a flexible pace, allowing you to soak in the atmosphere and discover hidden gems. The itinerary prioritizes easily accessible locations within a 5km radius of the city center, catering to a general interest in São Paulo's key attractions. Since you have no specific budget or transport preferences, we'll focus on free or low-cost activities easily reachable by public transport or walking. Prepare to be captivated by the city's diverse offerings!

points_of_interest.name: Pinacoteca do Estado de São Paulo
points_of_interest.description_poi: The Pinacoteca do Estado is one of the most important art museums in Brazil, with a focus on Brazilian art from the 19th century to the present. The building itself is a beautiful example of late 19th-century architecture.
points_of_interest.address: Praça da Luz, 2 - Luz, São Paulo - SP, 01020-020, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: Mercado Municipal de São Paulo (Mercadão)
points_of_interest.description_poi: A bustling public market housed in a stunning art nouveau building. Sample local delicacies like the famous Mortadella sandwich and pastel de bacalhau (codfish pastry). A feast for the senses!
points_of_interest.address: R. Cantareira, 306 - Centro Histórico de São Paulo, São Paulo - SP, 01024-000, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: Mosteiro de São Bento
points_of_interest.description_poi: A historic Benedictine monastery known for its stunning architecture and Gregorian chant performances. Check their schedule for mass times to experience the chants.
points_of_interest.address: Largo São Bento, s/n - Centro Histórico de São Paulo, São Paulo - SP, 01029-010, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: Pátio do Colégio
points_of_interest.description_poi: The historical landmark where the city of São Paulo was founded by Jesuit priests in 1554. Explore the museum and church to learn about the city's origins.
points_of_interest.address: Pça. Pátio do Colégio, 2 - Centro Histórico de São Paulo, São Paulo - SP, 01016-050, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: Edifício Martinelli
points_of_interest.description_poi: Once the tallest building in Latin America, the Edifício Martinelli offers panoramic views of São Paulo from its rooftop. Check the website for tour schedules and availability.
points_of_interest.address: R. São Bento, 405 - Centro Histórico de São Paulo, São Paulo - SP, 01011-100, Brazil

opening_hours.general: Mon-Fri 11:00-17:00 (check website for updated tour schedule)
